parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To call to myself, summon. Middle voice from pros and kaleo; to call toward oneself, i.e. Summon, invite.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A debtor. From a derivative of chrao and opheiletes; a loan-ower, i.e. Indebted person.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Or, its prolonged form opheileo probably from the base of ophelos; to owe; figuratively, to be under obligation; morally, to fail in duty.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
